definition: to depend on/to comply with or listen to sb/according to/in the light of
to touch/to come in contact with/to feel/to be affected by/to catch fire/to burn/(coll.) to fall asleep/(after a verb) hitting the mark/succeeding in
aspect particle indicating action in progress

sentences.english: We boated with his feelings for fun.
sentences.chinese: 我们依着他的感受，就是为了好玩。

sentences.english: The setting sun in dusk, rays and shoulders thrown in slightly fold.
sentences.chinese: 夕阳依着黄昏，霞光撒在肩头泛起的微微褶皱。

sentences.english: A couple of miles. Depends on how I feel. How about you?
sentences.chinese: 大概一两英哩路。依着我当天感觉如何来跑。你呢？

sentences.english: On motes light belief meet in the Peach Garden.
sentences.chinese: 依着微尘的灯光信念相逢在桃花源。

sentences.english: She really has it good. Everybody caters to her every need.
sentences.chinese: 她真是享受得很，大伙都依着他。

sentences.english: He didn't wish it, but she insisted.
sentences.chinese: 他并不想那么样，可她非要依着她不可。

sentences.english: They come into being under the unknown principle of nature.
sentences.chinese: 它们的形成，都伴依着一种大自然从不明讲的原则。

definition: let (one) have his way/as (one) pleases/at (one's) will
to allow (sb to do as he pleases)
to disobey/to defy/deliberately going against (rule, convention, sb's wishes etc)
above/on top of/on the surface of
(of alcohol) to go to one's head/(old) (of a bride-to-be) to bind one's hair into a bun/(of a prostitute) to receive a patron for the first time
to have no alternative/to be helpless
to not say a word (idiom)/to keep silent
solely engrossed in one thing/just (one thing, no need to worry about the rest)/simply/by all means/please feel free/do not hesitate (to ask for sth)
